author: Beatrice Gatta
comment: The notes can't be saved, unless you take out the phone and make a smart watch screenshot, but at that point you could just doodle on your phone. The notes can't be saved nor sent to anyone. You only have 3 buttons: the rubber (undo), a bin (clear all)  and an X that should exit the app. Too bad those 3 buttons only work maybe 1 time out of 5. This app is pointless.
title: No save function, keys are buggy

author: Jon Dunfee
comment: Has potential, wishing for more features (e.g. save, share) than ONE screen full of scribbles. Kinda makes it pointless, unfortunately.

author: Khandi White
comment: I got the kids paint app but... It takes me to google play store I do got the app but that's really confusing oh well stupid anyways...

author: Richard S
comment: Says it will install when connected to the nandroid watch in my watch is connected to my phone but will not install will not show up on my watch
title: Won't install

author: Ashique Khandaker
comment: The little x won't work on the moto 360

author: Nicolas Dini
comment: It would be great if you can save/share the doodle. I think you are close to something good!

author: Ali kazemi
comment: I have questions how to save

author: Thomas Crawford
comment: Good Idea but without saving it's useless...

author: pete the
comment: Not sure what the point of this is since doodles can't be saved or shared. Would be great if you could display doodles in a widget on your phone or at least save doodles to your phone for sharing from there. Ideally, sharing doodles from the watch would be best though.
title: Doodles can't be saved or shared.

author: Bryan Haugen
comment: Resynced apps with watch, and can't figure out how to open it on my LG g watch and phone side of app doesn't offer any guidance
title: Doesn't do anything

author: Anthony Dunk
comment: Nice but please add color and ability to save sketches.
title: Good

author: Kristofor Sherdley
comment: Doesn't work on moto 360 2. You can draw or write on the screen but tapping the icons at the top does  nothing and there is no way to save or share the note so what's the point?
title: Awful

author: David Evans
comment: Too small and fiddly to use on Moto 360.
title: Uninstalled

author: Cameron Chadronet
comment: this is everything I expected from an actual sticky note. ☺
title: perfect
